conclusion: To determine whether Object A and Object B have the same acceleration at time \( t_1 \), we need to analyze the velocity-time graph provided in the image. From the graph, at time \( t_1 \), Object A has a certain velocity, and Object B has a different velocity.

premise: The exact values are not necessary for determining acceleration, as we are interested in the slope of the graph at this point.

For Object A, the graph shows a curve that is decreasing in velocity as time progresses.

premise: The slope of the curve at \( t_1 \) is negative, indicating that Object A is decelerating.
conclusion: Object A is decelerating at \( t_1 \).
For Object B, the graph shows a curve that is increasing in velocity as time progresses.

premise: The slope of the curve at \( t_1 \) is positive, indicating that Object B is accelerating.
conclusion: Object B is accelerating at \( t_1 \).
